messages.subject: Re: UU church was: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling and Life
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 05/01/2003 1:53:32 PM Central Daylight Time, ... You just reminded me...I ve got an unschooling friend who tells a great story (true) about
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 05/01/2003 1:53:32 PM Central Daylight Time,
jmcseals@... writes:


> I'd say we are an agnostic
> family at this point...

You just reminded me...I've got an unschooling friend who tells a great story
(true) about moving to a small town in Texas and being asked, first thing
upon meeting a townperson, *So, what church do you go to?* Rather taken
aback, she replied, *Oh, I'm an agnostic.* The woman didn't bat an eye and
reassuringly said, *Well, that's okay, honey. I'm a Methodist!*

Laura


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: UU church was: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling and Life
messages.msgSnippet: ****You can also check out uua.org ~ personally, I didn t *get it* til I went and *felt it* in person at our fellowship. Rambling on... happy to share :)
messages.messageBody:
****You can also check out uua.org ~ personally, I didn't *get it* til I
went and *felt it* in person at our fellowship. Rambling on... happy to
share :)
diana,****

Thanks for sharing! I'm off to look for one nearby! I had looked into the
website, but you are right, I didn't *get it*. I'd say we are an agnostic
family at this point...we go through our phases <g>, but I *SO* miss the
fellowship of church!

Thanks again!
Jennifer
